The Elder Ghatamaṇḍadāyaka
“I thought of the Fortunate One,
the Leader of the World, the Best of Men,
who was sitting in the Great Wood,
afflicted with a wind illness.
After seeing (him) I purified my mind,
and brought a bowl of curd;
Because of that and because of the accumulation (of merit),
this Ganges is Bhāgīrathī to me.
The four great oceans,
are mixed together in my bowl;
And this terrible earth,
is immeasurable and incalculable.
After knowing my thought,
it becomes honey and sugar;
These trees in the four continents,
the trees that grow on the earth,
After knowing my thought,
they become wish-fulfilling trees;

translated: Fifty times I was the Lord of the Gods,🔽and I ruled as King of the Gods;
And fifty-one times🔽I was a King who turned the Wheel (of Power),
and a vast regional kingdom,
incalculable by number.
For ninety-four aeons,
the gift I gave then,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the bowl of curd.
I have burned up the defilements,
I live without defilements.
How welcome it was for me
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.
